page.title: 05Housing Development
page.content: The area is dotted with isolated farms, most still working. Villages on the edge of the grid such as Gnosall, Haughton, Ranton and Derrington have expanded considerably. Some farm cottages within the area are inhabited by families whose breadwinner commutes daily as far afield as Manchester. The nearness of the motorway allows such lengthy travel. The fact that such wokers are often moving around means that there are always some houses for sale with a regular community turnover in contrast to the stability of the population before the war. There is still a good community spirit and the old-established inhabitants have welcomed the newcomers.
